title: Jacob Fairbank
text:
Jacob Fairbank (born 4 March 1990) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays and for <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
Background.
Fairbank was born in <a href="Halifax%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Halifax, West Yorkshire</a>, England.
He is the nephew of <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> legend <a href="Karl%20Fairbank">Karl Fairbank</a>.
Huddersfield.
Fairbank signed for <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>, and progressed through the youth system, finally making his début in Round 23 of the 2011 season against <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>. Since then he made a number of appearances for the first team. He also spent time on loan at <a href="Oldham%20RLFC">Oldham RLFC</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 1349</a>).
Bradford.
In 2013, he was offered the chance to go to another <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> side on loan, <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a>. Fairbank signed a one-month deal at Bradford after they suffered an injury crisis in their pack. Fairbank featured in Round 15 (<a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>) to Round 16 (<a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>). He was injured for Round 17-18.
Wakefield Trinity Wildcats.
On 1 May 2014, Fairbank signed for the <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a> on a one-month loan deal.
Halifax.
In 2015, Fairbank signed a contract to join <a href="Halifax%20Panthers">Halifax</a>.
